intro: Pectis exilis, commonly known as the slender pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. Pectis exilis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and creosote bush scrub.
